item.title: Ticket #20666 (Custom header image cropping can create identical attachments) updated
item.dc:creator: SergeyBiryukov
item.description:
Replying to ryan:

Perhaps we should also call wp_upload_dir() to get a newly dated upload dir instead of reusing the old dir when cropping an existing image from the media library.

step_3() in wp-admin/custom-header.php would still expect the new attachment to be in the same directory as the original file:
​http://core.trac.wordpress.org/browser/trunk/wp-admin/custom-header.php?rev=20769#L877

item.title: Ticket #20669 (Replace Technorati with Bing) created
item.dc:creator: alexvorn2
item.description:
after WordPress install a check box appears with a message to "Allow my site to appear in search engines like Google and Technorati."

Technorati site is not so popular as Google, or Bing that are truly search engines... So please consider this small but intelligent decision to replace Technorati with Bing or Yahoo.

item.title: Ticket #20657 (Custom Header Image Cropping deletes header images) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: If the existing attachment is used when the image is not cropped, then _wp_attachment_is_custom_header could get stomped if the attachement is used by more than one theme. Wondering if always creating a new attachment would be best policy here.

item.description: Removes the variable

item.title: Ticket #20668 ($wp_did_template_redirect is unused) created
item.dc:creator: tamlyn
item.description: The global declaration at the start of load_template() in wp-includes/template.php (or wp-includes/theme.php before 3.4) imports a variable called $wp_did_template_redirect. This variable doesn't exist and is not referenced anywhere else.

item.title: Ticket #20667 (Cropping header image by height doesn't work with flexible height) created
item.dc:creator: SergeyBiryukov
item.description:
1. Add an image to Media Library which doesn't require cropping (1000x288 for Twenty Eleven).
  2. Go to Appearance → Header, click "Choose from image library".
  3. Select the image from point 1, click "Set as header"
  4. Crop the image by height only, e.g. to 1000x100, click "Crop and Publish".
  5. The original image is used, without any cropping.

Related: ticket:20657:10

item.title: Ticket #20666 (Custom header image cropping can create identical attachments) updated
item.dc:creator: SergeyBiryukov
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: 20666.patch attached to Ticket #20666
item.dc:creator: SergeyBiryukov

item.title: Ticket #20666 (Custom header image cropping can create identical attachments) created
item.dc:creator: SergeyBiryukov
item.description:
1. Add an image to Media Library which requires cropping.
  2. Go to Appearance → Header, click "Choose from image library".
  3. Select the image from point 1, click "Set as header", "Crop and Publish".
  4. Press browser's Back button, click "Crop and Publish" once again.
  5. Delete one of the two identical "Header Image" attachments in Media Library.
  6. The other attachment is now orphaned (the files are deleted in point 5).

Sounds like wp_unique_filename() should be used in there somewhere.

Related: #19840, #20657

Type changed

item.title: Ticket #11993 (Add post thumbnail from url) updated
item.dc:creator: lgedeon
item.description: Cc changed

item.title: Ticket #11993 (Add post thumbnail from url) updated
item.dc:creator: lgedeon
item.description:
media_sideload_image() can be extended to either:

  1. optionally return the attachment id (instead of html) so we can set_post_thumbnail( $post, $id ) with the results
  2. or we could include set_post_thumbnail( $post, $id ) in the function and add a boolean that says to make it the featured image
  3. or we could extract getting the attachment id into another function and make this function only responsible for building the html. Then if all I need is the id, I can call the extracted function instead.

I would love to write this patch, but would like to get your thoughts on preferred approach.

item.title: Ticket #20663 (add_image_size needs a $label) updated

item.description: Component, Description changed

item.title: Ticket #12877 (Modular themes: Apply template hierarchy to folders within a theme) updated
item.dc:creator: emzo
item.description: Cc changed

item.title: Ticket #20663 (add_image_size needs a $label) created
item.dc:creator: wycks
item.description:
add_image_size() does not have a $label parameter, this effects both localization but more importantly limits the image_size_names_choose filter.

The is when you try to add an image to a post and you can select sizes via the radio buttons.

Default sizes have labels like: 'large' => __('Large')

the image_size_names_choose filter is a great new filter that allows you to alter those radio buttons, but requires you to hardcore the array values for add_image_size() since it does not have a label (unless I'm missing something).

Reference code: ​https://gist.github.com/2668630

Related: #19990

item.title: Ticket #19603 (Support locale-specific modifications in core) updated
item.dc:creator: nacin
item.description:
Replying to pavelevap:

Should I reopen some of these tickets?

Yes, please! I have re-opened #10373.

item.title: Ticket #10373 (Proper number formatting related to i18n) reopened
item.dc:creator: nacin
item.description:
PHP 5.4.0 allows multiple bytes to be used for decimal points and thousands separators. Of course, we won't have 5.4.0 as a minimum version requirement for probably a decade. I am re-opening this to reflect our decision to begin incorporating locale-specific changes in core. (#19603, others.)

Which locales specifically need multiple characters to properly represent numbers?

item.title: Ticket #19603 (Support locale-specific modifications in core) updated
item.dc:creator: pavelevap
item.description:

I found another problem which should be solved in the case of removing locale.php files

​http://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/10373

Should I reopen some of these tickets?

item.title: Ticket #20657 (Custom Header Image Cropping deletes header images) updated
item.dc:creator: azaozz
item.description:
Replying to ryan:

A "Skip Crop, Use Image as Is" type button on the crop page was also discussed. If the image is within the flex limits, present another button that allows skipping the crop so you don't have to pointlessly fiddle with size selection. Seems like it would be a small patch and doable for 3.4, if we like it.

+1. Seems like the most logical thing to do.

item.title: Ticket #20662 (private post can be sticky via quickedit) created
item.dc:creator: maxemil
item.description:
While preparing translations to 3.4 I came across

​http://core.trac.wordpress.org/browser/trunk/wp-includes/class-wp-xmlrpc-server.php#L908

This indicates that a private post cannot be marked as sticky.

  • however it is quite possible to mark a private post as sticky while using quickedit.

Solution proposal, remove sticky tickbox on quickedit if post is private. Or if this is only related to the XMLRPC, fix the returnmessage to a warning "a private post will only be visible to you, so sticky might not make any sense".

I'm thinking.. "either its possible or its not, the logic should be the same"
